content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Because it's good to understand the notion of loops and arrays for a beginner

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like the simplicity of the task, it feels like grasping it would be easy

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like this, it is very simple to understand the intention and there are lots of test cases for understanding even better on how to tackle this challenge. Something that I might add to the description would be: "Assume that there is ALWAYS one solution on each case". So that clashers don't need to consume time thinking on edge cases where there are not three integers whose sum is 0

Output section
* "Line 2" should be changed to "Line 2".

Stub generator
* Suggest to change the first line to:
loopline 5 x: int
Reference: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/stub-generator

The reason is to match the variable name [[x]] used in the other sections, and also to provide the player with integers instead of a string. In my opinion this should usually be done when parsing is not the main focus of a clash.

Thanks.
Thanks for the feedback, I made changes accordingly. For the output, I assumed you meant "Line 1" , but I changed it to a three-line output to match the input instead.

Oops, you're quite correct in your assumption :P

And ok, thank you for making the changes :)

I assume that there is always a unique solution for each case instead of multiple solutions to choose from?
Yes, all test and validation cases were selected to have a unique solution.
